alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Isle of Wight and the central City of Suffolk through 515 PM EDT... At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Windsor, moving northeast at 15 mph. Another strong storm was near Franklin and was also moving northeast. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Windsor, Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Suffolk, Kings Fork, Carrsville, Longview, Lummis, Magnolia, Chuckatuck, Indika, Collosse, Wilroy, Lees Mill, Kilby, Walters, Boaz and Elwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
